summary: Telosian Council makes a press release.
title: Telosian Council makes a press release.
body:
Amongst the busy reporters and cameraman, a Togruta walks to the podium, the jewelry on his left horn shiny and pristinely as if to note the akul-tooth necklace. He clears his voice, nods to the reporters, and says:

“It is in these peaceful times that we focus our funding efforts on increasing our military might to guarantee readiness in the event that our beloved planet experiences the horrific events that we have once. We do not wait until the enemy is upon us to gather our men and women to go to war, we do not wait until then to acquire the skills or equipment to go to war, that is done ahead of wartime efforts.

"Moreover, not only will we have a strong military front at the ready, but will all be able to rest easier knowing that we have a brute force capable of destroying any force that dares challenge Telos IV again.  We do not want a repeat of history do we? So let us all contribute to building the Telos Security Force to protect us, our families, and our interest in our home, Telos IV.

This is why I, Taneo Marks, Councilor of the Eastern Region, and Councilor Alluxria of the Southern Region, am proposing the Fundamental Policy. A policy that aims to bolster the Telos Security Forces through trade tariffs, taxes, and cutting unnecessary funds.”

Taneo Marks pauses briefly and looks directly to the Imperial and Alliance reporters,
“Let it be known that if anyone dares to undermine this policy is an enemy of Telos IV and do not have the best interest of the citizens!”

Councilor Alluxria Ozai looks at her colleague with a shocked glare and states, “I am not as extreme in my conclusions about the citizens or officials that oppose this policy.  I welcome dissidence because it creates a window of opportunity for dialogue. But, I will be so audacious as to say I do not think that there is any policy that is or could be better.”

Later, which asked about the statement of Councilor Taneo Marks, a member of the Telosian nobility, Malius, the Archon of New Thani added his thoughts, “The Councilor’s statement absolutely reflects the opinions of the plurality of the Telosian nobility, as well as the best interests of the Telosian people. If Telos is to truly thrive, she must remain independent. I look forward to working together with the Councilor on this great task of leading our planet into prosperity.”

—

The feed would go to the newsroom where an Aqualish anchor would shake their head while reading the details of the proposed ‘Fundamental Policy’

Aqualish Male Anchor: Well from what I’m seeing this would mean large increases in taxes across the board.  We’ve also received word that Councilor Sano Sauro as well as the representative of Czerka have an unfavorable opinion of the proposal those far while the Ithorian’s lean towards abstaining.  It would have to meet a council majority vote and even then there’s a chance the Sovereign would veto the act if he has returned from his diplomatic trip by the time it comes to a vote, if not it would fall to the Consort.  Speaking of that diplomatic trip, so far the reports indicate that things are going very well as the Sovereign attempts to convince some of the neighboring planets to accept more refugees from the Core as many continue to flee the heavy handed Imperial presence there.

Human Female Co-Anchor: That is great news, Telos is seeing more than it’s share of new arrivals between that and these people who claim to have no memory of the last few years.  Hopefully the Sovereign will be able to return to Telos IV soon to address the immigration issue as I feel the Council is rather absorbed in the economy.

Aqualish Male Anchor: That’s all for tonight folks, this has been a Telos IV news update.

summary:
what she says: i'm fine.
what she means: did kylo ren see luke explode the hut before the connection was broken? Earlier in the...
body:
what she says: i’m fine.

what she means: did kylo ren see luke explode the hut before the connection was broken? Earlier in the movie he said he could only see her and nothing about her surrowdings and till that point in movie we had seen them talking but always in different scenarios. THEY WERE APART. But when they touched hands there he was in her envoironment… was kylo able to see luke? If yes, did their bond became stronger as they became closer or it was because they were touching? Was kylo terrified for rey’s life? And that one deleted scene where he’s waiting for her on the supremacy. Could he feel her presence in the force becoming ever closer or there was another force skype session where rey told him hold on i’m coming for you babe.

I have an armade of ships and would subsist on fanfiction if I could. NSFW stuff might appear on this blog so you have been warned. Formerly digimage.

summary: Honestly I just had this thought of how Jar Jar Binks might actually sound so high pitched because his species is supposed to be...
body: Honestly I just had this thought of how Jar Jar Binks might actually sound so high pitched because his species is supposed to be water dwelling me sound carries differently in water but then I remembered the other gungans. And then I had the idea of him smoking a Hookah like the Caterpillar from Alice in wonderland and having this nice deep voice cause it’s filled with a gas that does the opposite of helium. And then I thought of how funny it would be for a villain (Darth Jar Jar?) to do this because most can’t take a dark lord having such a high voice. Just imagine the incompetent minions breaking the hookah and then everyone just gets more and more horrified yet amused as their lords voice slowly rises in pitch and he threatens to choke anyone if they laugh and at least one person is the sort who laughs when they’re stressed so rip them.

blog.name: iidigestive-readerii
blog.title: ii Digestive Reader ii
blog.description: (fanfiction.net username) ii Digestive Reader ii My content tag: Star Wars and...

tags: eternal sadbess he said with a smile on his face
anyone who denies that can bite me
body:
Star Wars Headcanon

Want to cry about Obi-Wan? ‘Cause I have a new theroy.

What if Obi-Wan and Qui left Mandalore and received the mission where Tahl dies say - a month or two later?

Then perhaps a few months - four or five, just when Qui-Gon is starting to recover - boom, Banking Clan’s Trade Federation Blockade on Naboo.

And we all know what happened there.

So we get Obi-Wan - grieving for more things than he can possibly fathom within a year. He’s suddenly a Jedi knight to a scrappy, malnourished boy who doesn’t know manners, having to tell Satine Qui-Gon is dead, watching his best friend Bant struggle to adjust to Master Fisto’s tugelage, seeing his friends become knights normally, feeling like crying every time their braids get cut off by their own master’s instead of Master Yoda.

Don’t think that he pushes his away his own grief to care for Anakin, focusing his every attention on that boy, pushing away his friends desires to help, trying to prove he’s ready to be a master.

Don’t imagine that he collasped in exhaustion ar one point, getting promptly chewed out by Quinlan or Bant while they drag him to bed. Fighting Master Mundi/Koon/Fisto because “Anakin’s my responsibility, I’m fine” despite running a high fever.

Developing his drinking problem, watching his youth slip away, wanting to train Anakin properly, turn him into a model Jedi because “I was raised by a maverick Jedi, I can’t subject Anakin to the same scrutiny.”

Hating himself when Anakin becomes so high-strung, wondering where he went wrong, wincing when Master Windu mutters “Did we really expect Anakin to turn out much differently?”

Giving Anakin a padawan because “Hey, maybe this will help him calm down and learn to be a bit more chill.”

Feeling hopeless when the events of RotS come to light, living in grief and denial for 19 years, sucidal now more than ever.

Battling Maul once again, feeling some lick of satisfaction because he can kill the demon that took one of the few things he loved away from him.

Watching Luke turn into a kind person, feeling so much sadness when he faces Vader again, wondering how anything can be right again.

Feeling so happy when Anakin dies with light in his heart, shoving Padmé out of the way to embrace him first (also punching him in the face and yelling at him for a solid three hours later).

The happiness is only momentary though - he yells at Padmé and Anakin when Ben becomes Kylo Ren. “Does anyone know how to use contraceptives in your family?!”

No one does comment that there’s a Kryze running around the Galaxy pulling stupid stunts and womanizing half the populace. They leave him to figure it out.

He’s suddenly a Jedi knight to a scrappy, malnourished boy who doesn’t know manners, having to tell Satine Qui-Gon is dead, watching his best friend Bant struggle to adjust to Master Fisto’s tugelage, seeing his friends become knights normally, feeling like crying every time their braids get cut off by their own master’s instead of Master Yoda.

Don’t think that he pushes his away his own grief to care for Anakin, focusing his every attention on that boy, pushing away his friends desires to help, trying to prove he’s ready to be a master.

Don’t imagine that he collasped in exhaustion ar one point, getting promptly chewed out by Quinlan or Bant while they drag him to bed. Fighting Master Mundi/Koon/Fisto because “Anakin’s my responsibility, I’m fine” despite running a high fever.

Developing his drinking problem, watching his youth slip away, wanting to train Anakin properly, turn him into a model Jedi because “I was raised by a maverick Jedi, I can’t subject Anakin to the same scrutiny.”

Hating himself when Anakin becomes so high-strung, wondering where he went wrong, wincing when Master Windu mutters “Did we really expect Anakin to turn out much differently?”

Giving Anakin a padawan because “Hey, maybe this will help him calm down and learn to be a bit more chill.”

Feeling hopeless when the events of RotS come to light, living in grief and denial for 19 years, sucidal now more than ever.

Battling Maul once again, feeling some lick of satisfaction because he can kill the demon that took one of the few things he loved away from him.

Watching Luke turn into a kind person, feeling so much sadness when he faces Vader again, wondering how anything can be right again.

Feeling so happy when Anakin dies with light in his heart, shoving Padmé out of the way to embrace him first (also punching him in the face and yelling at him for a solid three hours later).

The happiness is only momentary though - he yells at Padmé and Anakin when Ben becomes Kylo Ren. “Does anyone know how to use contraceptives in your family?!”

No one does comment that there’s a Kryze running around the Galaxy pulling stupid stunts and womanizing half the populace. They leave him to figure it out.

trail.content_raw:
Star Wars Headcanon

Want to cry about Obi-Wan? ‘Cause I have a new theroy.

What if Obi-Wan and Qui left Mandalore and received the mission where Tahl dies say - a month or two later?

Then perhaps a few months - four or five, just when Qui-Gon is starting to recover - boom, Banking Clan’s Trade Federation Blockade on Naboo.

And we all know what happened there.

So we get Obi-Wan - grieving for more things than he can possibly fathom within a year. He’s suddenly a Jedi knight to a scrappy, malnourished boy who doesn’t know manners, having to tell Satine Qui-Gon is dead, watching his best friend Bant struggle to adjust to Master Fisto’s tugelage, seeing his friends become knights normally, feeling like crying every time their braids get cut off by their own master’s instead of Master Yoda.

Don’t think that he pushes his away his own grief to care for Anakin, focusing his every attention on that boy, pushing away his friends desires to help, trying to prove he’s ready to be a master.

Don’t imagine that he collasped in exhaustion ar one point, getting promptly chewed out by Quinlan or Bant while they drag him to bed. Fighting Master Mundi/Koon/Fisto because “Anakin’s my responsibility, I’m fine” despite running a high fever.

Developing his drinking problem, watching his youth slip away, wanting to train Anakin properly, turn him into a model Jedi because “I was raised by a maverick Jedi, I can’t subject Anakin to the same scrutiny.”

Hating himself when Anakin becomes so high-strung, wondering where he went wrong, wincing when Master Windu mutters “Did we really expect Anakin to turn out much differently?”

Giving Anakin a padawan because “Hey, maybe this will help him calm down and learn to be a bit more chill.”

Feeling hopeless when the events of RotS come to light, living in grief and denial for 19 years, sucidal now more than ever.

Battling Maul once again, feeling some lick of satisfaction because he can kill the demon that took one of the few things he loved away from him.

Watching Luke turn into a kind person, feeling so much sadness when he faces Vader again, wondering how anything can be right again.

Feeling so happy when Anakin dies with light in his heart, shoving Padmé out of the way to embrace him first (also punching him in the face and yelling at him for a solid three hours later).

The happiness is only momentary though - he yells at Padmé and Anakin when Ben becomes Kylo Ren. “Does anyone know how to use contraceptives in your family?!”

No one does comment that there’s a Kryze running around the Galaxy pulling stupid stunts and womanizing half the populace. They leave him to figure it out.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina
